text: At Kerstbierfestival 2016. Thnx for sharing ! Pours unclear blonde / amber. Small white head; Smell is sour, sharp, some funk, oak. Bit too sharp, some glue character. Taste is sharp, bit bitter, sour, dough, barrel, oak. meh.. Not really deep nor complex.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Aroma of tart, mild booze, herbs and peat, strangely enough. Taste has grassy herbs, mild peat, tart and oak. Strange lambic.

Thank you BDomua! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT 2016-1. Bottled 16SEP2014. Dark orange, little white head. Nose is weird plastic, almost bit peated, weirdly salty, messy, funk. Taste is sour, faint peat, almost smoked, sour plastic, vaguely salty, funk, citrus peel, grapefruit, Sour, malt, faintly peated almost. I have been hoping to try one of these for a long time, this one is bit of a disappointing. Strange flavours that I didnt really get into. Wild alright but a bit too wild & weird for me personally.

Warm golden colour, white head. Aroma of roses, funk, malts, grapefruit. Sour flavour, grapes, malts. Finish grapes, funk. Nice. As Birra speciale maturata in legno.(from 75cL bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Thanks for sharing, BDomua!)
Sampled from bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Clear yellow to light orange color, small white head. Smell and taste a light fruity touch, brett, apricot, fruitpeel tart lightly. Quite nice.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Clear golden colour with no real head. Smells sourish, dusty, nice. Tastes slightly sourish, dusty, alightly fruity, pretty nice. Medium body, soft carbo.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 75 cl bottle vintage 2013 @ Kinnarniemi. Bottled 11.06.2013. Aroma has earthy notes, fruit candy and grapefruit. Flavour is tart with grapefruit, some orange and mild earthiness. Theres a sweetish orange tone that do not usually exist in Belgian ones. Refreshing, balanced and very good.
Cloudy golde, nice white head. Smells of lemon, dust, funk. Very lemony flavor, with notes of vinegar and dust. dry finish. Very tasty.
A small taste from a friend (bottle) @ Il Birrificio. Pours cloudy golden with a high head. Aroma is sour malts. Flavor is sour malts with some apples. Not bad.

750 from Capones. Batch 4, 2014, Bottle 774. Pours hazy gold with frothy white head. Nose is of tart fruit, apricot, peach, yeasty funk. Tastes very funky, yeasty, with tart fruit, tannins, and hops.

bottle @ home
clear yellow, white head
I like this beer, but I remember it better than this bottle.
quite similar to a tipical lambic, but whit some cellar notes

Rated ti 29.12.2015.[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Yellow hazy. Funky, wheaty hay citrussy nose. Lemon woody, stables. Tart, citrussy, quite refreshing body. Quite a bit of acidity really, bit dry lemony, some yeasty notes in finish. Pretty tasty, lemony sour.-- bb
Aroma: dry cider, wheat, berries, mold. Appearance: pale, hazy, white head, medium lasting. Taste: heavy sour, light bitter. Palate: medium body, creamy texture. Astringent aftertaste.
Hazy orange liquid with thic head. Aroma of cider vinegar. Taste of berries, light sweet, light bitter, medium sour. Medium body, light feel, average carbonisation.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with medium sticky-thick head. Aroma is sourish, wheat, fruity, citrus, weak vinegar. Taste is sour, berries, yeast,weak vinegar, mold. Medium body. Easy and smooth to drink

750 ml bottle

The second member of a world class flight compared well to the previous Raphael. Taking the sour experience in a different direction, it demonstrated why Panil is one of the only Italian breweries I am willing to pull the trigger on. Give it a shot if you somehow exhaust the Belgian list of unblended lambics or just want something different.

Aroma / Appearance - A bronze semitransparent base rests below an ivory head. Sheer legs release waves of sharp blue cheese, vinegar, and acid. Funky and bright, it has a residual aroma of caramel.

Flavor / Palate - A fluid caramel base binds together honey and ranch dressing. Oak, sour cream, vanilla, and malt vinegar work together in a way that defies all logic. The profile of this particular lambic sets it apart; rather than trying to imitate its kin from further north it carves out a unique niche.

Bottle 0.75l at The 8th Belgrade tasting Session Two at Alberto place in Pozarevac.18.07.2015.Thanks ippopotamo36 for this bottle.Ciaoo brate.Pour it hazy orange color with big white head.Aroma of cellar.Taste of sourness, citrusy, wodden barrel feel.Parmesan after taste thanks Matt once again for description.

At the 8th tasting (round 2), held in Vranovo and Pozarevac. Bottle purchased at Johnny Off L in Rome-Italy. Pours a fantastic bright golden color, cloudy with a medium white cap. Nose: funky notes of wild yeast, vinegar, mint, sour. Mouth: citric, lemon zest, very easy drinking, sour. Meant for summer, so tasty!

At Belgrade Eighth Tasting, round two. 750. Hazy orange, creamy head. Tart first sip, funky cheese body, fresh parmesan. White vinegar. Washed rind cheese funk aroma, full tart and round. Slight yeasty banana. Lovely, strong tasty beer.

had at the gingerman .. . amber slash .. mild bubbles .. . tangy, tart wet wood and easy yeast .. . razing mouth and solid finish .. quite good .. . . 

i had that dream again last night...
Bottle thanks to Paul. Pours a clear orange with small frothy white head. The aroma is funk, oak, and fruity malt. Medium mouth, nice funk, light fruit, lingering dryness, very nice.

Bottle. Hazy yellow. Soapy head. Funky brett style aroma. Wet paper in a great way, Citrus barrel notes, champagne yeasty feel. Light refreshing clean. Average carb, Tart. Wow, awesome. Clean. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy gold with a frothy white head. Aroma is peach, yogurt and earth. Taste adds tart lemon and musty papery funk. Very bright and clean. Light carb and somewhat short finish. Awesome.

A- pours a clear gold with a tight off white head. Great lacing. S- white grapes, Brett, apples, lemon must and oak. Not overly complex but enjoyable. M- light to medium body with a light tartness. T- strong mineral tastes rolls through the mouth somewhat abruptly with a dry and zinc ending. Lemons, Brett, vinegar, white grape skins and tannic quality. Some earthiness and oak.

Bottle at Zwanze Day 2014. Pour is hazy orange with a frothy white head and good lacing. Big funky, stone fruity, peachy, grassy, some cheese and lemon in the aroma. Taste is barnyard, apricots, light urine, wood notes, some oranges, grassy, and herbal with a semi-sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Great balance of funk, sour and drink-ability. Tasty stuff - would love to revisit, but seems a bit pricey.

Bottle in the Zwanze Day line shared by ruckusdu. Thanks! Pours a cloudy yellow appearance with a big, off white head. Pretty funky nose with some barnyard, hay, lemon, coconut, and oak as well. Moderately low sweetness and bitterness. Moderately sour flavor that has a bunch of funk, lemon, wet paper, and herbal hops. Drinks pretty good.

Bottle (750mL, batch 3, 2014, bottle 1556).

Head is initially large, frothy/creamy, white, fully lasting.
Body is hazy dark yellow, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers), with light notes of lemon zest, oak, sour apple skin.

Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

I wouldnt really call this a lambik just as far as how it looks, smells, and tastes, but its an enjoyable sour ale nonetheless. Sadly, theres not a lot of aroma, and it has a rather "fresh" quality thats somewhere between a Belgian blond and a generic sour ale. In the mouth theres a fair bit of bitterness to match the sourness, so its quite dry, but theres just enough residual sugar to keep it drinkable. Big frothy, lasting head looks nothing like lambic, but I cant deny its beautiful. Nice mouthfeel too, very velvety, not as fizzy/cracklin as most lambic. So, yeah...on the fence about this one. Quite nice, but not worth the price.

Nice brew, though quite expensive for "nice". notes of barnyard, lemons, and oak. Medium sour and fairly tangy and dry. A little high on the carbonation, but otherwise pretty dang good. 6.5% batch #2."

Bottle... Pours cloudy and golden with a small, creamy, white head. Fantastic retention. The nose is citrusy, woody, funky and acidic with a lightly-spicy clove phenol. Medium-bodied with a mildly creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. The flavor is tart, citrusy and lightly spicy with a tongue-numbing finish. By "tongue-numbing," Im not talking crazy-bitter or crazy-sour. Im saying it numbs my tongue like a topical anesthetic. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!

750 ml bottle shared with the Quebec City crew. Pours a very cloudy orange with a resilient white head. Aroma is tart, fruity, oldish. Flavor is fruity, peach, pear. Finish is tart, unripe fruit. Medium body, overly carbonated.

Hazy golden colored body, thin white head, and soapy lacing. Oak, lactic, floral funk, must, a bit soapy, toasted malt. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, lively acidity, lingering finish, fairly soapy/chemically in the back half.
Bottle shared at Ryans, pours Hazy golden, notes of chlorine, amaretto, biscuit, watery funk. I like the finish on this one. Ligh pucker. Light to medium in body.
A very good oude gueuze from Italy. Complex aroma that introduces a nice sour taste with flowery and wild fruity notes.

Bottle w/ Chris. Pours hazy yellow, at least as best as I can tell by way of the bit of blue lingering in the sky at 10:15 on this late-June Seattle night. Burnt rubber and medicinal aroma, lemon of course, wood. Not aggressively sour, just tart, almost sweet-tart, white grapefruit and lemon, again that rubber, sawdust. Tasty if not exception.

2013 bottle (b1) shared by tom10101, many thanks dude. pours cloudy pale yellow with a surprising frothy white head, good retention and lacing. funky dust, wheat, nice fruitiness - citrus, apricots, bitter herbs, few soapy and (unfortunately) a disturbing chlorine presence. light acidity - relatively complex acidity profile. bright carbonation, light body - oily, astringent-tannic grassy-herbal finish. if chlorine is put aside, this would be a very nice attempt, if not a success, in lambic territory.

Bottle 750ml [2013, b1]
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of rusticity, apricots, rubber, citrus. Taste is of rusticity, nice citrus, rubber, slight chlorine. Palate: Light body. Soft carbonation. Overall: Pretty good, but just a little something too weird here to be excellent.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head and good lacing. Nose is weird, a mix of rubber, acid and cholophenols. Not weird enough to deter me from sampling it, though. Taste is nice and clean lactic acidity and really fruity. It feels like you are drinking a nice white wine, really. Body was light to medium, carbonation medium (huh?). Really nice even though the nose is bad. It is really good once you get used to it!

Bottle (750 ml). 2013, batch 1. Hazy straw color with a small persistent white head and some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, funk, leathery notes, but also some off rubber and chlorine presence. Taste is of leathery brett, nice funk, citrus, rubber and chlorine. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Dry finish. This unblended lambic is quite authentic and theres many interesting features, but the rubber/chlorine presence is a turn-off for me.

750mL bottle, pours an opaque, cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out moderate barnyard funk, slight acidity, and dough. Flavour is very close to an authentic unblended lambic, with barnyard funk, leather, citrus peel, and vegetal notes. Really awesome unblended lambic, but with carbonation - unlike more traditional versions of the style. Wonderful stuff.

2013 batch #1, Bottle #885

pours hazy golden with a thick sticky head

smells funky, yeast, fruit, citrus and pine

tastes starts off sweet then gets pleasantly sour finishes like a dry champagne

heavy carbonation, medium body

Batch 1; 2013; Bottle 246. Capped 750 from the Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours translucent gold with a transient fizzy white head. Aroma suggests the old fashioned cap pistol caps after explosion. Near med body. Flavor is very oaky with some sour apple, and still has that "cap" aspect . Finishes dry, sour and weirdly bitter.

Batch 1- 2013 bottle 2046 shared by bhensonb. Pours light golden with a white head that lasted but a few seconds, and a strange fruity aroma. There is a fairly sour oaky fruit flavor with a dry finish.
Pours a slightly cloudy light orange character . Light citrus aroma, medicinal, rubbery phenolics. Flavor is very citrusy, medcinal, rubbery, sweet and tart.

Bottle share thanks to doofus197. Smell of phenolic bomb. Band aid. Smokey. Plastic. Plastic. Gross. Cloudy yellow barge white head. Taste is slightly less offensive but not good by any means. I think I would rather stab myself with rusty scissors than drink this burnt rubber garbage. Thanks bro
Bottle share thanks to DrewFace! Pours cloudy orange with white head. Aroma is slightly tart, sweet. Taste is quite tart, maybe sweet, I like it as much as a kick in the nuts, better sweeter.

Bottle at James place for A Clocking New Years! Pours a very faintly hazed gold with a thin white head. Lemony funk on the nose, big musk and citrus peels. Medium-bodied, soft funk with a nice acid tone, hints of acetone but lovely funk covers it all up. Long musk and big cheesy funk into the finish. Amazingly good.

At jtclockworks. The aroma is lemon, slightly sour, clean. The appearance is cloudy, swirling yellow, thin white head. The flavor is lemon drop, tart, oak. The finish is tart lemon, wood. Really nice, refreshing. Slightly thin in body. Great beer.
Big thanks to clockwork for popping this for me. Pours cloudy orange with funky nose. Tastes of lemons, sour grapefruit, horse blanket, and wet wood. Tasty treat.

Bottle thanks to Dany (and Jay for muling). Shared at Clocking New Year. Pours lemon gold with white head. Nose and taste of rustic funk, sour malt, lemon, lemon cake, horse blanket and oak. Medium body. Perfect balance. Delicious.
Backlog bottle thanks to so many good ratebeerians. The smell is sour, tart, acidic. The look is yellow in color, white fizzy head. The taste is tart, fruits, not too sour.

Bottle @ Bobbys house. Shared by GT. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Really funky nose. Sulfur, sawdust, grass, and brine. A bit of must and damp straw. Flavor is a bit tart and lactic. Pretty funky. Lots of grass, sulfur, sawdust, and green apple. Some must, straw, and a touch of hot dog. Not a big fan.

750mL from La Bodega. Pours a clear, light golden. Weak foam. Nose is salty, sulfury, dishwater- volatile notes clean up over time to some solid peach and saltwater. Taste is peach, chardonnay, apricot, fairly juicy. Palate feels a bit soapy and thin.

Bottle, 2013 Batch 2. Pours a light orange with a light white head. Smell is light funk and citrus but very mild on both counts. Taste has a bit more action -- lemon, tart, funk, hay, wood. Bright and clean with nice white wine notes. Lightly carbonated, fairly lively on the palate. Nice palate-cleansing dinner beer, it was great with some vegan soul food.

From 10/18 notes. 750ml bottle, batch 1. Has a nose of tart apple skin, light funk, also getting some melting plastic aroma. Mouthfeel is well carbonated and crisp. Taste is sour, oak, apple, citrus, more plastic notes. Finish is tart, sweet apples, woody. For me, its a bit strange.

Bottled nicely but I did not enjoy the taste at all. Very very hoppy flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Hertie for sharing! Pours a light cloudy dull yellow with a nice white head. Smell is leather, wood, tart sourness, pepper, grass. Taste is dry tart wood, leather, dry Riesling - super dry ending. As the beer sits it mellows and become very approachable.  Light body and active carbonation. An interesting brew.
2009 bottle..Nose is funk, tart, fruits, wet wood, yogurt, cheese..Taste is funk, light fruits, spices, white grape skins,
Shared with ABL, just before wubz was sick. Barnyard funk if you like, some lemon, very nice.

I thought it was a Faro but it is not, obviously. Really funky barnyard taste going on here, whisked us away to an Italian rustic hideaway. Cant wait for ABL to do the Led Zep thing. It wont involve fish probably.

Bottle... Poured hazy amber/golden with a thin head. Nice barrel and sour tones on this one. Refreshing, not too hard on the palate. A little drying towards the finish with some fruits and acidity along with a hint of funk.
Rated in April 2012 (Backlog) - Cloudy gold with an average sized white head. Aroma is of lemon and light funk. Taste is tart with notes of lemon and hay.

Bottle #518. Amber beer with a cream head. Tart/sour aroma with light fruit. Tart/sour flavor with light fruit, earth, and light oak. Medium bodied. Tart/sourness and oak linger with summer fruit and earthiness.

750 mL, big thanks to Zack for sharing!! Hazy straw colored pour, bubbly white head that dissipates quickly. Nose and flavor bring big funky barnyard, bright vinegar tones, stonefruit, biting lemon acidity, horseblanket. Bold, in your face, and very very tasty. A treat.
Looks like unfiltered apple juice, smell of tropic fruits with a fermented fruity sour taste, not mutch oak. A great lambic.

Pours a slightly hazy orange golden color with a finger of fizzy eggshell foam. The nose is fruity with notes of leather, new sneakers, stonefruit, apple, lemon and dusty funk. The palate follows with a nice balance of tart funk and fruit... there is a touch of offness as it warms up slight touches of band aid come through.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 Green bottle, 75 cl, bottled on 11 guilio 2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on April 21 2013; eye: old gold, hazy, no effervescence, off-white head that disappears completely, no lacing; nose: sourness, acidity, green apple, leather, slight Brettanomyces yeast, slight woody, farm; mouth: acidity, green apple, leather, Brettanomyces yeast, horse, slight woody, light sourness, farm, lightly sour finale with presence of acidity, medium body, rather carbonated, a bit thin; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 75 c1, embouteillée le 11 guilio 2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 21 avril 2013; il : vieil or, voilée, pas deffervescence, mousse blanc cassé qui disparaît complètement, pas de dentelle; nez : aigreur, acidité, pomme verte, cuir, très léger levure Brettanomyces, très léger boisé, ferme; bouche : acidité, pomme verte, cuir, levure Brettanomyces, cheval, très léger boisé, légère aigreur, ferme, finale légèrement aigre avec présence dacidité, corps moyen, plutôt carbonatée, un peu mince; en résumé : bien
750ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy light gold with no head.  Aroma is old socks, Stilton and sour lemon.  Taste has cheesy lemonade to start.  Sour lemon finish.

taken from notes - 750 ml bottle at sloshfest 2012. Nice bottle, not only the looks but the cahracter of the beer is very vinious and fresh: some grape and floral notes. Refreshing palate (gentle carbonation) and nice crisp balance. Myeah, like.

Bottle from Quebec private order, 2009 brewed, released in 2010. Near vinegar and yeast, a great geuze like beer.  More malty when I first had it, I saved the second half of the bottle for later that day as carbonation eased so did the head and more aggressive vinegar.  Still very drinkable.Hard on the palate, though not as much as some Cantillons.

Ambrata, torbida. Schiuma fitta supportata da un elegante e fine perlage. Aroma agrumato, acido, legnoso, fruttato molto pulito. Al palato ingresso carbonato, acido. Le note acide e della frutta acerba sono equilibrate da un elegante sentore legnoso. Finale secco. Bevuta interessante. Ottima lambic.

Bouteille de 750ml sans étiquette avec un petit livre cartonnée. Liquide embouteillé le 11 guilio 2012. Le liquide est jaune dorée sans mousse, ce nest pas un gusher comme ses compagnes de cette brasserie italienne. Le nez est évidemment très sauvage, il y a une tonne dacide et du citron. On se rapproche du vinaigre. En bouche le liquide est passablement mince, vinaigré, acide avec une finale sur les bretts. Pour amateurs avertis.

Panil Divina est une longue bouteille de 75 cl qui emprisonne son liquide depuis le 11 juin 2012.  De couleur jaune dorée, la robe trouble laisse paraître un mince anneau de mousse.  Le nez est très intéressant.  Il ya des notes fruitées aigres et des notes transpirantes de blé.  Je pense ici au citron et à des agrumes du même acabit.  Il y a des notes boisées qui transpirent des raisins blancs bien aiguisés.  Il y a des notes de yogourt nature et de croûte de fromage.   Au niveau des saveurs, les notes mordantes de blé et le citron font bon effet.  Les notes lactiques refont surface et prennent une vigueur certaine.  Des pommes vertes coupantes se joignent à leffet du fût de vin français.  En bouche, je peux aisément dire que le liquide fabrique un assèchement sans pareil.  Il y a une fraîcheur dans ce mouvement docilement brutal.  Les tissus sont attaqués mais ils se complaisent et finissent par en redemander.  En finale, les notes remplies dacidité et de fruits ensoleillés me laissent dans un certain état dappréciation.
Pours hazy dark yellow with almost no head. Aroma is some lemon, citric and quite some leather. Taste is moderately sour with some wood. The normal one is much better.
Bottle @ 2nd tuesday tasting. Aroma is vanilla, butter, wood, slight sourness. Flavour is green apple and lemon sourness, some spice and some buttey wood. Prefer the regular.
Clear golden, almost no head. Strange aroma of sourness apple and sweetness. Like the normal version better.

Slim 75cl bottle, looks like a wine bottle. Label says Divina, oak aged. Hazy pale golden colour, white head. Aroma is floral, sour lemon, light wood. Flavour is sour, lemon, paper, light wood, all very light and crisp. Nice and refreshing beer.

750ml bottle (BierKompass.de)
Very pleasant slightly sour aroma, a little cantillon-like, giving me some pleasant woodiness, a touch of citrus, and some white grape and apricot sharp fruitiness. Pours a slightly hazy peach, with a large brief spongy head. Slightly watery palate, but refreshing, carbonation crisp at first, but the palate is a little unsatisfying. Taste has the citrussy sour base, again a bit fou-foune-like, but sharper. Later as the carbonation disappears and the glass warms, the simple bready base comes out more, and its very pleasant, quite soft. Theres also a touch of yeastiness that accompanies the citrussy sourness in the finish. Was a better beer than the movie. Sourness was clear but restrained. Well made and certainly very tasty.
2009 bottle thanks to blackswan.  pale yellow pour with a white head.  nose is hay, spices, fruits, tart, cherries.  great on the palate, sour, cherries, tart, lemony, acidic, and a clean finish.

2009 bottle thanks to blackswan/bu11zeye. Pours with a large white head that lasts over a somewhat hazed golden hued body. Aromas are very musty, plastic, peach esters, peppery, vegital, bell pepper and lobster boil. Flavors are floral, musty, funky and medium acidic. Lively bubbles, dry.

Bottle shared at bu11zeyes 10,000th rating tasting. 

The beer pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma has a lot of wheat and yeast notes, with some lemons also thrown in. The flavor is similar. I get some light funk, with some tart lemons, Belgian yeast and a hint of tartness. The beer is fairly dry and is easy to drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
bottle from bu11zeye 10k,  clear yellow pour with sparse white foam, aroma is lactic, brett, plastic, flavor of sour brett and citrus, sugary, raw wood
Bottle from Blackswan.  Labeled as Divinatale.  Light pour with a small head.  Aroma is a little funky, old shoes, and lemon grass.   Tate is sour, dry earth, and kinda woody.  Dry, dusty finish.

(750ml bottle, 2009 vintage)  Pours a clear yellow body with a spare white head.  Aroma of leather, herbs, yeast, yogurt, and citrus.  Flavor of citrus, yeast, berries, earth, grass, and wood with a dry finish.

(750ml bottle thanks to blackswan) clear yellow, visible lasting offwhite carbonation. Nose is funky, lightly tart, a bit white wine grapes, really nice. Taste of light white wine grapes, bit funky, wheat, well carbonated, and refreshing. Good beer for the style.

Bottle pour at Erzbierschof. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Smells of horse blanket, grass, some spice. Tastes dry, crisp, tart grape, medium sweetness, yeasty bready qualities. Light bodied, no carbonation, oily texture. Finishes dry and acetic.

30th October 2011Bottle in Rome, purchased from Domus Birrae. Light haze on this pale gold beer. Little off white head. Light semi dry palate. Crispish. Smooth sour beer. Not at all puckery. Seems like some oak? Mild lemon citrus. Finishes dry. Pleasant sour and very drinkable.

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée avec Goldorak et des amis lors dun souper de Noël. Arôme: Légère odeur de pommes et dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pommes vertes et dgrumes avec une pointe de fruité. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement acide. (Rating #4089)
Appearance: Light Orange Aroma: Wood, yeast Taste: sour, little sweetness Palate: mb Overall: 18/20. Well balanced!

Süß-saurer Antrunk, der stark an Berliner Weisse erinnert und auch entsprechende Milchsäurenoten beinhaltet. Dazu trocken, holzig. Gleichzeitig weich. Auch im Verlauf ist das Bier geschmacklich näher an Berliner Weisse als an Lambic, weich, angenehme Säure, erfrischend. Geringe Grasigkeit, hintergründig Noten von Apfel. Konstant säuerlicher Ausklang. Wirklich gut!! 6/12/13/11/8/12

Bottle shared with Plovmand. 
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. 
Aroma is surprisingly good, oak, dirt, dry grape and apples. 
Flavour is sweet green apples, grape, dirt and oak, slightly acidic with at sweet balance.

Bottle shared with Anker. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is acid, barnyard, grapes, dusty cellar and citrus. The flavour is quite fruity and has some acidic notes. Grape fruit, dust, blanket and citrus. Some sweet fruit. Citrussy finish. Quite quaffable and drinkable.

Bottiglia: Hazy, pale golden to golden, mid-sized and slowly collapsing fluffy white head, lively (!) carbonation; sourish-wheaty aroma, wood and sweet honey underneath; a bit fizzy, light to medium bodied, sweetish-sourish flavour; drier woody and sourish finish with a sweet counterpart. Fine, fine, fine.....

Bottle from Domus Birrae, Rome; vintage 2009, 6% ABVHazy blond color; thin head. Nice aroma, sour, with fruity accents; some Bretts, but also light plastic. The body is lean, with light malt flavor, and decent sourness; but there is also a stale bread note, and very light plastic. The final too is a bit breadish. Pleasant, but unelegant.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2011 Questi di Torrechiara fanno delle birre molto originali, ma a dire il vero non sono così tanto costanti. Comunque superiore alla media. edit: Migliorata col tempo!

Splendida birra a fermentazione spontanea in legno, la nuova Divina è meglio della sua corrispondente "morbida" (Red), sembra quasi un lambic belga.Earlier Rating: 3/13/2010 Total Score: 3.9Lambic italico? se la Divina normale non mi ha mai convinto più di tanto (pare un po verdura lessata), questa Divinatale dovrebbe essere la norma, altro che la specialità: se non fosse per qualche noterella di gomma un po spiacevole nel sapore, direi che può benissimo competere con la Barriquée Sour e aggiudicarsi un posto accanto a lei nellolimpo delle (poche purtroppo) acide italiane "di classe".

Hazy blonde with a thin but lasting white head. Nice citrussy and brett aromas, some pineapple in there. Light body, lively carbonation, nice bretty character, fresh palate with its lemony  dominance, mild bitterness that fits perfectly. Very refreshing wild ale-saison hybrid. Delicious summer brew.

Incredibly sticky large white foam remains dense on the glass as the level goes down and this makes for a spectacular showdown over the dullish cloudy pale golden hue. Very surprising nose, certainly wild and countryside-like with refined oak notes, but surprisingly agressive medicinal phenols that become tiresome after a whole bottle. Speaking of which, that unlabeled 750 ml bottle is beautiful, all in feminine curves and pretty much the 750 equivalent to the curvy Orval smaller bottles. Nice stuff although that is not so surprising from an Italian brewery. Back to the beer, it showcases a confident, refreshing citrusy character that fits the countryside cereals nicely. Attenuation is of course stellar, the beer being dry all throughout and despite that feature and the low alcohol level, it feels rather nourishing and filling, never feeling thin, I was surprised to learn this is lower than 6%. So all in all, we have a fun and relatively complex tannic ale loaded with farmy and lemony character, but a bit intense on the phenols. There is nothing quite like it, so its an achievement in todays wide-spread brewing world, but I cant say I appreciate it as much as Divinale for instance, their other attempt on the wild side.

In short: An intensely rustic blonde ale of some kind.  Dry, citrusy
How: Bottle 750ml, split three-way.  Mega-thanks to Fred82 for hooking me with this gem after I screwed up our order of that very beer
The look: Cloudy yellow body topped by a small white head
In long: Superb strong rustic nose, this is not lambic-funky, this is just intensely rustic.  I often use my own description of walking in a countryside field, but rarely has it been more true than with this beer. Taste is loaded with hay and dry wheaty cereals (light sensation of Shreded Wheat), some citrus fruits notes and that omnipresent rustic yeast character.  I suspect the not-so-high ratings on this one is because it is classified as a Lambic.  This is obviously no lambic.  If I was to compare Panil Divinatale to one beer it would be a Jolly Pumpkin Weizen Bam, only less funky but more rustic (if that makes any sense).  This is one fancy high-priced beer that I would love to session.  It is very expensive but I will buy more bottles if given the opportunity because I have a great investment strategy.  With the economy going down and homelessness on the rise, Im investing my money in shopping cart manufacturers.

750ml bottle from IPB. Shared with glouglouburp.
Appearance : Light hazy yellow. Light lacing.

Aroma : Great citrusy tartness with nice light funk. Some wheat and malt.

Taste : Very citrusy and tart with nice malt and light funk. 

Overall : Ok, granted this is not that close to a real lambic nor is it as complex but this is still a really tasty brew. I really enjoyed the intense citrusy notes and the great tartness. It sometimes felt like a blend between a lambic and a berliner weisse (you get the picture ?). Funk is very light but present. This was very drinkable and refreshing. If the price tag wasnt that high and it was more accessible, Id session this all summer long...
Bottle. Blonde, cloudy. Rubber, leather and citrus in the aroma. Moderately sour vinegar-like flavor with lemon, vegetable notes and rubber. Decent.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2011 Bottled 75cl. An amazing beer. Definitely underrated. I reveled in each sip of this beer on a wonderful sunny day and didnt feel like writing my impressions. Fantastic. At least a 4.2 for my tastes.

750ml bottle, bright golden color, with a white head, leaving some belgian lacing, mild yeasty, funky, wild yeast brettiness, dusty, barnyard, cobweb, wet oaky nose with some light tannic white wine barrel accents with some sour green apple, juicy, acidic lemony notes and some tart, subtle lactic, doughy aromas follow through on a medium-bodied palate with a light yeasty, acidic, fruity, bretty, funky, white winey oaky character with some sour lemon juice, green apple, faint rhubarb tart flavours with some lemon, grapfruit, zesty rind, tannic wineyness undertones with a hint of bready dough, wheat malt, lactic milkiness, leading towards a sour fruity, acidic lemony, white grapes mustiness, funky, winey dry finish

Bottle: Poured a lightly hazy yellow color lambic with a super large foamy head with excellent retention and some very good retention. Aroma of light barnyard with some tart notes and dominating french oak notes. Taste is also heavily dominated by tart notes with light barnyard notes and some dry french oak notes. Acidity is well balanced by light sweet notes in the aftertaste. Body is somewhat full with great carbonation.  Very easily drinkable thought maybe not as much as a Girardin gueuze.
Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of grapefruit with funk and wood. Dry and tart flavour with fruit and grain.
Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is acidic, leather and barnyard. Flavour is acidic, barnyard and horse blanket.
Bottle @ Papsø-Grand-Tasting, September 2010. Pours cloudy yellow with a small creamy bubbly head. Nose is tart. Brett and fruit. A bit of almond. Pretty good.

Bottle 750ml.Unclear hazy medium grey yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, citrus acidic, barnyard, sulfur, straw, leather notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a average to long duration, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100910]

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white ehad.
Light acidic aroma of berries with notes of barnyard.
Light acidic flavour of berries, cereals, brett and barnyard.
Tart finish.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Cloudy yellow - white head. Light sourish notes, barnyard, fruity, plastic jug, wooden notes, light bubblegum, acid, leather. Wierd - but ok.
Hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma had barnyard, leather, wood and lacto. Flavor was bone dry with rubber, wyeast, lemons and hay. Finished dry and sour.

cloudy white,smooth white head.
sourish arma, hops present. nice.
flavor is  mild sourish,  easy drinking lambic, verynice.
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is dry and acidic wheaty. Light peppery. Citric and mild barnyard note. Citric and orange fruity into a citric and dry finish.
Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a huge lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemon and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemon, straw, hops, leading to a dry lemony finish.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Very tart aroma, lots of barnyard and Brett. Light body, very dry and tart with great and authentic barnyard. Ends dry and tart but highly drinkable. A lovely Lambic. 100910

Bottle. Tnx Caesar. The aroma has barnyard, yeast, apples (The green, real apples, not the alcoholic apple aroma) and is a bit sourish. Cloudy, yellow coloured beer with a white head. The taste is a bit sour/tart, has barnyard, citrus and aprikot. Good beer.
Bottle @ kloneo, thx caesar. Murky light golden colour, white head. Nose is yeasty, apple, apricot, barnyard. Flavour is yeasty, sour apple, fruits. Nice sourness, I like it.

Bottled. Hazy/cloudy yellow color, short head. Aroma is slight fruity, bit dusty, barnyard. Slight sour taste, bit thick weizen banana taste as well. Not the traditional belgian lambic flavor, but it taste like a hefeweizen combined with lambic.
Hazy golden colored brew. Some sourness in the aroma, fruits, very mild. Flavor has sourness, citrus, lemon, Mild flavor with a good balance.

Bottle from Domus Birrae, Rome.
Hazy yellow. Sweet grapes, peaches, dry tongue feel. Funky lambic style barnyard and sourness. Citrus, dirt, aged beef, old gouda, gym socks. The wild yeast character of the original is mellowed a little by the barrel aging, but there is still lambic funnkiness aplenty here.
Complex, but not too extreme. This could be used with food, in food or as a schoolbook example on how tom make lambic outside Belgium.
I think it is time for Panil to expand a bit, this should be widely available!
